resources.string: In order to use this feature during a ride, your Garmin device needs to be connected to your Android device, and Garmin Connect Mobile needs to be running.
In the event of an incident, all of your emergency contacts will be notified via email and/or text message. Swipe to remove.
It looks like your emergency contacts were removed from your phone. Add a new emergency contact.
Are you sure you want to cancel this incident?
You have not added your location (city and state). Leaving will disable Incident Detection.
This will send a message to your emergency contacts that says you are OK.
Contacts must have a phone number or email address. Select a contact that has at least one of those.
Garmin Connect needs access to your contacts. Without this, Incident Detection cannot work properly.
A message has been sent to your emergency contacts.
A message has been sent to your emergency contacts that you are OK.
If you do not need help, you can let them know that you are OK.
You have not added your name. Leaving will disable Incident Detection.
You have not added an emergency contact. Leaving will disable Incident Detection.
Your emergency contacts will be notified in:
Notifying emergency contacts that you are OK...
Garmin Connect no longer has permission to access your contacts. Without this, Incident Detection cannot work properly.
We were unable to send a message to your emergency contacts.
Message will be sent when an internet connection becomes available.
An internet connection is needed to compare your data with the rest of Garmin users!

"The Instant Keyboard allows you to quickly enter characters directly to your device using your smartphone's keyboard.
Your Garmin device must be turned on and connected to Garmin Connect Mobile over Bluetooth. Only supported languages will be displayed.
To disable Instant Keyboard, go to Settings > Instant Keyboard and toggle the switch to Off."
Characters will appear on your device as you type.
Turn on to automatically bring up Instant Input in Garmin Connect Mobile when entering text on your device.

You can enable and disable your Snapshots, as well as reorder them at any time. Just press the menu icon from your Snapshots view.

"Editing zones in percent is an easy way to segment your heart rate responses. You can provide your maximum heart rate and resting heart rate and select the percent ranges that are meaningful to you. Editing in beats per minute allows more precise definition of your heart rate zones. For example, you can define your heart rate zones according to perceived levels of exertion, such as heart rates in which you would find it difficult to talk. You can also establish custom zones based on levels you've observed during performance testing."
When would I edit in percentage mode as opposed to in beats per minute mode?
The zone data error was not fixed. We will reset it to its previous acceptable state.
The number you selected is outside the acceptable range. Make sure it is greater than %1$s and less than %2$s.
Catch Up on the Latest Connect Features
Share your Garmin Connect calendar to Office 365
Hold to view the controls menu
Scroll down to the phone icon

Also known as FTP, Functional Threshold Power can be considered to be the highest power level that a cyclist can maintain for an hour without fatiguing. A cyclist would be able to ride at power levels below their FTP for considerably longer than at levels above FTP.
Garmin Connect is working slower than usual. Some things might take longer to load.
Sorry, we are down for maintenance. Check back shortly.
What activities will be displayed in the Activity Feed?

When you entered your resting heart rate, your heart rate reserve was created, and your adjusted zone levels are based on that. To calculate a heart rate zone level, take your intensity percentage and multiply it by the difference between your maximum heart rate and your resting heart rate, and add that result to your resting heart rate.
Why did my heart rate zones change when I entered my resting heart rate?
Enter your heart rate zones by beats per minute (bpm) or by the percentage of your maximum heart rate. bpm/% of Max are automatically adjusted when the other value is changed.

To improve your health, organizations such as the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the American Heart Association (AHA), and the World Health Organization (WHO) recommend 150 minutes per week of moderate-intensity activity, such as brisk walking, OR 75 minutes per week of vigorous-intensity activity, such as running.You must do at least 10 minutes of moderate or higher intensity activity at a time to get your health benefits and for your Garmin activity tracker to count it.Use any combination of moderate and vigorous exercise to achieve the goal for adults of 150 active minutes per week.
To gauge the intensity of your activities, use the following guidelines:
Moderate Intensity: You can have a conversation, but not sing while exercising.
Tip: A minute of vigorous activity counts for twice as much as a minute of moderate activity.
Vigorous Intensity: You can only speak a few words between breaths while exercising. Vigorous-intensity minutes will only be recorded when heart rate data is available.
Selecting Yes will remove the My Fitness Pal data from the My Day snapshot. You can add it back by connecting to My Fitness Pal in Settings > 3rd Party Apps.

You must have at least one zone, and can have up to ten zones on Garmin Connect Mobile. Garmin fitness devices are limited to five heart rate zones, so keep that in mind when modifying your zone levels.
How many heart rate zones can I have?
Your goal needs to be at least %1$d minutes.
To reach your goal, you need:
So far today is in balance.
So far today is very stressful.
L Peak Power Phase Arc Length

Percent Heart Rate Reserve (%HRR) is defined as the difference between your maximum heart rate and your resting heart rate. Heart rate reserve creates logical boundaries around which your heart rate will fluctuate during an activity. Utilizing your resting heart rate can help you further personalize your training.
"I'm familiar with % max. HR but what does %HRR mean?"
%1$s will become the new group owner.
You are currently connected to the MyFitnessPal app, showing Calories In/Out on your My Day Snapshot and in the Calories In/Out stats feature.
There is no map data available for this activity.
No timeline data for this day.
Sync your device to see timeline.
"Sync your device to see today's timeline."
You can now view your calories from MyFitnessPal. To disconnect, visit the Settings > 3rd Party Apps section.
You must have at least one Snapshot selected to proceed.
You typically need at least a week of training history before we can determine your Training Status.

A good way to measure your resting heart rate is during the morning right after you wake up from sleep. Count the number of times your heart beats for 1 minute. You can also wear your heart rate monitor and track your heart rate on your Garmin device while your body is at complete rest. You may want to take 3 measurements and average them for a more representative reading.
How can I obtain my resting heart rate?
This user has set their profile to private.
R Power Phase Peak Arc Length
Great! Drag and drop your Snapshots in order of importance.

The calories burned at rest is called the Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR). Add the calories burned throughout the day by doing things like breathing and circulating blood to get to your resting calories. Today, your body has burned %1$s BMR calories.
The calories burned at rest is called the Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR). Add the calories burned throughout the day by doing things like breathing and circulating blood to get to your resting calories.

"The calories burned at rest is called the Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR). Add the calories burned throughout the day by doing things like breathing and circulating blood to get to your resting calories. Sync your device to view today's BMR calories."
"Based on your devices or profile, these Snapshots will provide you with the data that's relevant to your activities. Select which Snapshots you'd like to view."
You may see some changes from the previous version of Connect Mobile. With Snapshots, our goal is to give you quick views of the data you care about most.
Your Active + Resting Calories = Total Calories.

To enable Auto Start, select a Share method.
Starting an activity on your device will automatically start LiveTrack.

To share an activity in real time, first start a LiveTrack session, then start an activity on a Garmin device.

Users can view all of your LiveTrack events for 24 hours after stopping LiveTrack.
Allow users to view your LiveTrack events for 24 hours after stopping LiveTrack.
Auto Start allows your Auto Start compatible device to begin LiveTrack sessions when you start an activity without opening the app on your phone. The LiveTrack session will use your sharing settings.
In some situations, your Facebook or Twitter verifications can expire. Selecting Email as an additional share method can ensure that your LiveTrack sessions are always shared.
Use LiveTrack to share activities from your Garmin device in real time.
1. Add invite recipients to the application. Each time you create a new LiveTrack session, your invitees receive a link. You can edit this list each time you start a new LiveTrack session.
2. Start the LiveTrack session then start an activity on your fitness device. As long as the app and your device are connected, your activity will be shared in real time with those invited.

Add or invite recipients to view your LiveTrack session. Each time you create a new LiveTrack session, your invitees receive a link. You can edit this list each time you start a new LiveTrack session.
Start the LiveTrack session then start an activity on your Garmin device. As long as the app and your Garmin device are connected, your activity will be shared in real-time with those invited.
To use LiveTrack, at least one sharing method must be turned on. After starting a LiveTrack session, your friends can watch by viewing the link created by LiveTrack.
Share your LiveTrack session with Strava users through Beacon. From your Strava Premium account:
You can turn your Strava sharing on and off from your Strava account.

Once Beacon sharing is enabled from your Strava account, your LiveTrack sessions will be shared with your Strava friends through Beacon.

Your friends can see where you are, time elapsed, distance, speed, and elevation. If you have ANT+ sensors, they can see additional data like heart rate or cadence.

"Insights help you gain a deeper understanding of your activities and how they can affect your health. Over time, your patterns and habits can even help determine your ability to meet the goals you've set for yourself. Insights are delivered to you when enough data has been logged to trigger an Insight event. The more you log, the more frequent the Insights. Logging various types of information such as activities, calories, sleep and steps will provide more variety in your Insights.
You can opt out of Insights at any time. All Insights content (the \"Content\") is for general informational purposes only and is not intended to be used for medical purposes or to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or condition. The Content is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay in seeking it because of something you have read on Insights."

Garmin Connect uses your data to provide information related to your activities and logged data. You can opt out of Insights at any time. All Insights content (the \"Content\") is for general informational purposes only, and is not intended to be used for medical purposes or to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or condition. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition.
Log and sync activities using your Garmin Connect compatible devices to compare your stats with other Garmin users.
You are unsubscribed from Insights. You will no longer receive new Insights online or in our mobile app. To enable Insights, select Subscribe from the options menu.

"Use the power of fun to get fit! Join a friendly competition with people who are stepping the same amount as you. If you have the most steps in a week, you win.
As you improve week to week, you will advance to groups with higher step goals to keep you motivated and competitive."

"When your movements match familiar patterns, such as walking, running, biking or using the elliptical machine, Move IQ will automatically identify the event and display it in your timeline.
When activities are identified your device will begin recording them once they go longer than your specified time. These will be added to your activity history."

"Move IQ automatically identifies movements that match familiar patterns, such as biking, running, and using the elliptical machine. These events help you see what you've done throughout the day, but do not show up in your activities list, snapshots, or news feed. For more detail and accuracy, record an activity by using the start/stop timer on your device."
This is a Move IQ Event.
When you record an activity using a Garmin device, we calculate the calories burned based on your activity level, age, height, weight, gender, and heart rate (if available).
There is weight data from the Garmin Index smart scale that will be cleared. Do you want to replace it with the new weight?
If you are active throughout the day, MyFitnessPal.com adds the Active Calories to your Calorie Goal. This is called the Adjusted Goal.

"MyFitnessPal.com can help you determine a calorie goal based on whether you want to gain, lose, or maintain your weight. When you've determined the proper number, try to reach it with a combination of activity and healthy eating."

"When you have determined a MyFitnessPal calorie goal, we'll help you track how many daily calories you are above or below your goal. The formula is Adjusted Goal - Calories Consumed = Calories Remaining."

Insights help you apply your fitness and health data to your daily life.
You can accomplish this recommendation in a shorter time frame by increasing your intensity. Vigorous activity counts for twice as much as moderate activity.

VO₂ Max is an indication of your cardiovascular fitness and should increase as your level of fitness improves. VO₂ Max is the maximum volume of oxygen (in milliliters) you can consume per minute per kilogram of body weight at your maximum performance. Your compatible Garmin device uses heart rate and exercise data to estimate your VO₂ Max.

VO₂ Max. and Cycling VO₂ Max. values may differ because the muscles used for each activity have different oxygen requirements. Your body adapts to consume oxygen differently for each exercise and may be more or less optimized for each.
"Your %1$s is %2$s, which is %3$s for women ages %4$s."

Your %1$s is %2$s, which is %3$s for men ages %4$s.
Advanced heartbeat analytics by Firstbeat®. Data used with permission from The Cooper Institute®, Dallas, Texas. The Cooper Institute

Body Mass Index (BMI) is your weight in kilograms divided by your height in meters squared. BMI is useful for standardizing weight and size comparisons across male and female populations, regardless of age or frame size. However, BMI can be misleading if used without consideration of other body composition metrics like body fat percentage. For example, people who are highly trained and muscular athletes may be overweight, but not overfat.

Expressed as a percentage of total weight, identifies how much of your weight is attributable to body fat, including both essential fat and storage body fat. Essential body fat is required for basic health.
"Expressed as a percentage of total weight, identifies how much of your weight is attributable to fluid in the body and can indicate a person's level of hydration."
Identifies the total amount of bone weight in your body, measured in pounds (lb), kilograms (kg), or stone and pounds (st or stlb).

Identifies the total amount of muscle weight in your body, including skeletal muscles, smooth muscles (e.g. the heart and muscles surrounding the digestive track) and the water contained in those muscles, measured in pounds (lb), kilograms (kg), or stone and pounds (st or stlb).
